item.title: Emacs Tutorial, Exporting Org-Mode Files To PDF, Episode 1
item.description: Emacs Tutorial, Exporting Org-Mode Files To PDF, Episode 1 The above video demonstrates inserting text and images into an org-mode file. I use a function in emacs initialization to pull images from a specified directory into org-mode files. See below. The first function, "get-newest-file-from-dir" is used in the second function, "insert-org-image". It's the second function I'm calling from a hydra when I pull images from the downloads directory. With a little more code you can easily combine downloading and pulling images into org-files, in fact the emacs package easy-hugo has a download, process, and insert image into your blog (markdown or org file) function baked into it.

item.title: Emacs Tutorial, Wget, Curl, Headless Chrome
item.description: A brief introduction to Wget, Curl, and Headless Chrome. Wget and Curl and small programs easily installed through your package manager, or directly by downloading and installing. Headless Chrome can be installed from the command line using node and node's package manager npm. Install node globally and add add it to your path (or use your package manager to install it). Ensure npm is installed. Headless Chrome can be used globally or in a local working directory via a package.
